Rodimus =
had nearly made it back to his own chambers when Perceptor's
call came thro=
ugh. "On my way." Rodimus said as he jerked to
attention. Sprinting back to=
 Nightlight's room he carefully looked

Carefully he picked her up and began to w=
alk toward the protected

He silently wondered what was goin=

f battle. "Perceptor, what's

Mea=
nwhile,

Cyclonus sat looking at the security screen, one of them orienting=
 on
the battle between Tuscon and Nightshift.

Even as he watched, Scourge =
came back from his search of the base. "I
haven't found anyone, but I found=

transmitter.

Cyclonus looked at it and no=
dded, "They have been here. They must be
growing tired of waiting for word.=
"

Scourge nodded, "I knew it had to be one of them. Most don't have the
sk=
ills to do this."

Cyclonus took the transmitter as it suddenly chirped and=

wrote itself across its screen. With a raised eyebrow Cyclonus r=
eached
down and opened a link to Hydras, "Sir." he said formally, "We need
=
you in the command center, somehting has come up."

Cyclonus turned to look=

ng not a sinlge move to interfere.
